gc-param.description: Use serial garbage collection
Do garbage collection on young generations before performing full GC cycles
Limit the proportion of time that the VM will spend in garbage collection before an OutOfMemory error is thrown
The maximum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap shrinking. The default is 70
The minimum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap expansion. The default is 40
The maximum size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 1.4, this is computed as a function of NewRatio
The maximum size of the permanent generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
Ratio of old and new generation sizes. The default is 2
The default size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
Ratio of eden and survivor space. The default is 8
The target percentage of survivor space in use after a scavenge
Print messages when garbage collection takes place
Print more details in garbage collection messages
Print timestamps in garbage collection messages
Enable GC log file rotation. Requires -Xloggc:filename, which enables logging GC messages to file
The number of rotating log files to use. Must be greater than or equal to 1. The default is 1.
The maximum log file size in bytes after which the log files will be rotated. Must be greater than or equal to 8K. The default is 8K.
use the G1 Garbage Collector
the max GC pause time goal in milliseconds that G1 will attempt to meet. The default is 200
percentage of total heap occupancy at which a GC cycle will be triggered. The default is 45
the time interval over which GC pauses totaling up to MaxGCPauseMillis may take place
ratio of old a new generation sizes. The default is 2
Ratio of eden and survivor space. The default is 8
Maximum value for threshold of object tenuring. The default is 15
The maximum size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 1.4, this is computed as a function of NewRatio
The maximum size of the permanent generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
The number of threads to use during the parallel phase of GC
The number of concurrent GC threads to use
Limit the proportion of time that the VM will spend in garbage collection before an OutOfMemory error is thrown
Do garbage collection on young generations before performing full GC cycles
The maximum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap shrinking. The default is 70
The minimum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap expansion. The default is 40
The default size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
The target percentage of survivor space in use after a scavenge
The target duration of individual concurrent marking steps
The threshold that defines a "hot card"
Log base 2 of the size of concurrent Remembered Set "hot card" cache
The number of update buffers that are left in the queue by the concurrent processing threads
Number of enqueued update buffers that will trigger concurrent processing
Number of enqueued update buffers that will trigger concurrent processing instead of enqueueing them
Select green, yellow, and red zone sizes adaptively to meet the pause time requirements
The last concurrent refinement thread wakes up every specified number of milliseconds to do miscellaneous work
The number of threads to use for concurrently updating GC remembered sets. If not set then the default is ParallelGCThreads + 1
Each time the remembered set update queue increases by this amount, activate the next refinement thread, if available
Confidence level for MMU/pause predictions
Overhead of concurrent marking
If true, enable reference discovery during concurrent marking and reference processing at the end of remark
The size of G1 heap subdivisions. Minimum 1Mb, maximum 32Mb
The maximum threshold of heap space which is permitted to be wasted. GC cycles will not take place when the reclaimable space as a percentage is below this threshold. The default is 10 percent
The number of "mixed" garbage collection cycles to perform after a marking cycle. The default is 8
The percent of "live" objects in old generation regions under which a mixed GC will be performed. The default is 85
The threshold percentage of wasted heap space. The default is 5
The maximum number of regions
Size of a work unit of cards claimed by a worker thread during Remembered Set scanning
Maximum number of entries per region in a sparse table
A target percentage of time that is allowed to be spent on processing Remembered Set update buffers during the collection pause
The number of discovered reference objects to process before draining concurrent marking work queues
The percentage of amount of heap space reserved to reduce promotion failure. The default is 10

Before enqueueing them, each mutator thread tries to do some filtering on the SATB buffers it generates. If post-filtering the percentage of retained entries is over this threshold the buffer will be enqueued for processing. A value of 0 specifies that mutator threads should not do such filtering
Number of entries in a SATB log buffer
Size of an update buffer
When expanding, the percentage of uncommitted space to claim
Print messages when garbage collection takes place
Print more details in garbage collection messages
Print timestamps in garbage collection messages
Enable GC log file rotation. Requires -Xloggc:filename, which enables logging GC messages to file
The number of rotating log files to use. Must be greater than or equal to 1. The default is 1.
The maximum log file size in bytes after which the log files will be rotated. Must be greater than or equal to 8K. The default is 8K.
Use parallel garbage collection for the young generation
Use parallel garbage collection for the both the young and old generation (automatically enables UseParallelGC)
Limit the proportion of time that the VM will spend in garbage collection before an OutOfMemory error is thrown
Do garbage collection on young generations before performing full GC cycles
The maximum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap shrinking. The default is 70
The minimum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap expansion. The default is 40
The maximum size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 1.4, this is computed as a function of NewRatio
The maximum size of the permanent generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
ratio of old a new generation sizes. The default is 2
The default size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
Ratio of eden and survivor space. The default is 8
The target percentage of survivor space in use after a scavenge
The number of threads to use during the parallel phase of GC
Print messages when garbage collection takes place
Print more details in garbage collection messages
Print timestamps in garbage collection messages
Enable GC log file rotation. Requires -Xloggc:filename, which enables logging GC messages to file
The number of rotating log files to use. Must be greater than or equal to 1. The default is 1.
The maximum log file size in bytes after which the log files will be rotated. Must be greater than or equal to 8K. The default is 8K.
Use the Concurrent Mark and Sweep collector for the old generation
Limit the proportion of time that the VM will spend in garbage collection before an OutOfMemory error is thrown
Do garbage collection on young generations before performing full GC cycles
The maximum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap shrinking. The default is 70
The minimum percentage of heap size free after a garbage collection cycle to avoid heap expansion. The default is 40
The maximum size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 1.4, this is computed as a function of NewRatio
The maximum size of the permanent generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
ratio of old a new generation sizes. The default is 2
The default size of the new generation, in bytes. Since 5.0, 64-bit VMs are scaled 30% larger
Ratio of eden and survivor space. The default is 8
The target percentage of survivor space in use after a scavenge
Print messages when garbage collection takes place
Print more details in garbage collection messages
Print timestamps in garbage collection messages

The number of rotating log files to use. Must be greater than or equal to 1. The default is 1.
